intro: Diacarpa alata, commonly known as the winged diacarpa, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that dehisces to release seeds.
